docs.title: Your index page
docs.text:
The landing page for your documentation.

You can go to the API reference.

docs.title: Using math
docs.text:
You can use inline math like \(y = x^2\). Or $$ blocks:

\[ \lim_{x \to \infty} (1 + 1/x)^n \]

And even ```math blocks:

\[ \lim_{x \to \infty} (1 + 1/x)^n \]

docs.title: Using mermaid diagrams
docs.text:
And also mermaid diagrams:

flowchart LR

x --> y

docs.title: MyExampleClass
docs.text:
Source code in mkdtemp/__init__.py 
class MyExampleClass:
    def __init__(self, x: str):
        """An example class. It has one property.

        Args:
            x (str): A meaningless string-valued property.
        """
        self.x = x

    def what_is_x(self) -> str:
        """A meaningless accessor function.

        Returns:
            str: The value of this class's single property.
        """
        return self.x

docs.text:

required Source code in mkdtemp/__init__.py 
def __init__(self, x: str):
    """An example class. It has one property.

    Args:
        x (str): A meaningless string-valued property.
    """
    self.x = x

docs.text:
A meaningless accessor function.

def what_is_x(self) -> str:
    """A meaningless accessor function.

    Returns:
        str: The value of this class's single property.
    """
    return self.x
